page.title: 14TREVELGUE HEAD
page.content: There was Iron Age pottery from 4-2 B.C. There was a Yorkshire-type lynch pin, a terret ring, a triangular bronze link, a wire finger-ring and a dolphin-type broach (early 2 B.C) A Vespasian coin (c.71 A.D.) and a Trojan coin (c.107 A/D.) were also found. Two rows of round houses, which were build across the island were found, two of which were excavated. The style in which the outside walls, which held the thatched roof were constructed was unique. Large arch-shaped stones were put up-right and the space between filled with dry-stone walling. This sturdy construction is thought to belong to the Celts, who were skillful workers.One of the ramparts was excavated.
